subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: Now that Joe Calzaghe has beaten all comers in the supermiddleweight ranks, he is waiting for the light-heavyweight Bernard Hopkins.“Whatever way he wants it he can have it as long as Joe gets well paid,” Frank Warren, Calzaghe’s promoter, said in Cardiff, Wales, after the unbeaten Calzaghe captured the W.B.A. and W.B.C. supermiddleweight belts from Mikkel Kessler on Saturday to go with the W.B.O. title he has held for 10 years. “So there’s no excuses. Be a Ray Leonard. Be a Marvin Hagler. That’s what we want to see from Bernard Hopkins. He can pick the date, he can pick the town.”.
